Every May, we recognize our incredible mothers. We are indebted to their sacrifice, inspired by their wisdom and emboldened by their love.

This #MothersDay, let us remember to hold our loved ones extra close during this difficult time. https://t.co/VvTbLguqJI
Visited the New Hartford Fire Station today with First Selectman Jerram. Thank you to our volunteer first responders for all that you do to keep our communities safe! https://t.co/w6mWhzXSUG

Great stop at Carbone's Market in Torrington with Mayor Carbone and Winsted Mayor Perez! Thank you to all of our small markets for being there for our communities during these difficult times! https://t.co/VrIT03UwSS

The only way we can safely & responsibly open CT & our country is through testing! As a member of the White House Congressional Task Force to re-open the country I've urged the Trump Administration to increase our testing capacity. It's time they deliver.
https://t.co/QHwnrMr9Eu
Thank you to all of our Nurses in Connecticut and across the country! #NursesWeek https://t.co/3ha5xB06eB

Eager for a kid-friendly way to explore national parks from home? Check out this free, online Junior Ranger booklet about America's first transcontinental railroad, made possible by @NatlParkService, @GoParks, and @UnionPacific. #FindYourPark https://t.co/JvmTQUV3jR

Our @CTNationalGuard soldiers are vital to protecting CT residents and supporting the effort to slow the spread of #COVID19. I joined the CT delegation in urging the Trump Administration to extend federal authorization and funding for our National Guard. https://t.co/mmruL7Xgux

It was great joining @CTWBDC, @SBAGov & @MdsxChamber for a virtual town hall via Zoom to talk with small business owners impacted by COVID-19. Small businesses have been hit incredibly hard by this pandemic and I will continue to fight for the relief they need. https://t.co/PaBBEBT0Bu
We need to #ExpandSocialSecurity and put money in the hands of those who need it most during #COVID19 : seniors, communities of color, and people with disabilities - not corporations.
#COVID19 puts our families at risk, especially seniors. The Emergency Social Security Benefits Improvement Act will #ExpandSocialSecurity and protect our seniors.
Trump's proposed payroll tax cut will harm Social Security and greatly benefit large corporations. I believe we need to help our most vulnerable, seniors, and #ExpandSocialSecurity.

We should be strengthening #SocialSecurity, not giving a payroll tax cut to corporations and the wealthy. That's why I introduced the Emergency Social Security Benefits Improvement Act, to help our most vulnerable during the #COVID19 pandemic. #ExpandSocialSecurity

Fontline workers struggling to find or pay for childcare during #COVID19 can now apply for assistance provided through #CTCares. This program offers direct payments to child care providers, so frontline workers can continue to work. Learn more here: https://t.co/PTBM83aLi8

Our nation’s nurses work tirelessly to keep our communities safe and healthy. We owe them our deepest gratitude. 

This #NationalNursesDay, we must honor our health care professionals by making sure they have the resources they need to save lives. https://t.co/0F5vZWbjAQ
Scammers have been using the coronavirus pandemic to take advantage of people. Do not fall victim to an IRS scam. You can learn more at https://t.co/1c3sZCtJO7

The greatest resource our country has are Americans who are willing to step up and serve. We need to tap into that resource by investing in National Service opportunities to respond to and rebuild from this crisis. https://t.co/yPn8K5PI4j

#COVID19 has taken a severe toll on nursing homes across the country, including here in Connecticut. Yesterday I joined my colleagues in urging @HHSGov allocate funds to increase COVID19 testing to contain and prevent the spread of this virus in these facilities. https://t.co/E3DrTuJzmo
During this time of economic uncertainty we should be expanding our nation's #1 anti-poverty program. #SocialSecurity provides Americans with certainty & support. https://t.co/RWXOxvcdTZ

Yesterday I joined my colleagues in requesting @SBAGov provide EIDL status updates to applicants & provide Congress with processing updates. These loans are a vital lifeline to millions of small businesses during this crisis and they must be distributed properly and with urgency. https://t.co/iUW67JJCBt

Today is #TeacherAppreciationDay! These challenging times have reminded us of the incredible value of our nation’s teachers. Thank you to all of our teachers who continue to shape students’ lives. Tag your favorite teacher in the comments below! #ThankATeacher https://t.co/vuJy6fK4x6

REMINDER: VA & SSI beneficiaries who have dependents & don’t normally file a tax return have until TOMORROW to fill out the non-filers form online to receive their $500 per dependent child economic impact payment this year. You can use link below: https://t.co/bW8nPuLhKt

#COVID19 has exposed the longstanding health disparities in communities of color. As we move forward, we must ensure our most vulnerable communities have access to #COVID19 testing they need. https://t.co/F03r7mszpf
Happy #TeacherAppreciationWeek! Thank you to all of our teachers who continue to go above and beyond for our students during this challenging time. https://t.co/8vM4dwdLFA

This #MayDay I stand in solidarity with those on the frontlines fighting for safer working conditions. Our frontline & essential workers including our delivery drivers, grocery store clerks, & janitors are keeping our communities going during this pandemic & deserve our support. https://t.co/FGZHpUvaGg

The #COVID19 pandemic has brought economic hardship to all types of workers and families. We can't leave anyone out of relief efforts. That’s why I’m supporting @RepDanKildee’s bill to make UI work for everyone, including students and part time workers. #StrongUI

As so many lives have been disrupted by this pandemic, our charitable non profits have served as the backbone of our communities. I joined my colleagues in urging full support to these organizations as they continue providing frontline services in response to the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/btqRMhiID1

I am so inspired by countless stories like this showing how our communities are pulling together during this crisis. Thank you to this group of teenagers from #WestHartford for helping out their elderly & immunocompromised neighbors. https://t.co/nezBTjCyts

Our seniors are among the most vulnerable to the health and financial impacts of this pandemic. We should strengthen #SocialSecurity now to ensure our seniors are protected during this crisis.
https://t.co/o9fpqFKguu

https://t.co/Va57X5qVfp

Nursing homes are among the hardest hit by the #COVID19 epidemic, which is why I am urging @CMSGov to protect residents in these facilities. We must do more to protect the most vulnerable. https://t.co/UDnDd6GHf9

Today is #WorkersMemorialDay. We remember all those who have been lost in the line of work or by diseases caused by work. 

We must never forget the sacrifices of those on the #Frontline protecting us through this pandemic and must recommit to protect workers. https://t.co/33ne6ay8Kn

Our #Frontline medical workers are our soldiers in the war against this virus and we must give them the protections they deserve. I joined my colleagues in calling on future #COVID19 relief packages to include provisions to protect #Frontline medical workers. https://t.co/CEn9kt5Ui4

America is experiencing the highest numbers of unemployment since the Great Depression. The CARES Act expanded assistance to help workers during this unprecedented time. You can find more information about Unemployment Insurance during #COVID19 here https://t.co/V5EN9nfMcL

The Families First Act guarantees employees ten days of sick leave at 100% wage replacement if they are quarantining under the advice of a healthcare provider, government order, or seeking a medical diagnosis related to #COVID19 More info here: https://t.co/jxa7Qc85RZ

The IRS is working to deliver your Economic Impact Payment. If you haven't received payment, check to see if you need to provide additional information or find answers to your questions at https://t.co/l7EuQIpNpE

The impact of #COVID19 has left uncertainty with stable housing. If you are currently residing in public or assisted housing, under the CARES Act, you are protected from eviction for four months if you cannot pay your rent. More information here: https://t.co/vtalQLGL2S
ATTENTION SMALL BUSINESSES: The Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) application processing will resume Monday at 10:30 am.  More here: https://t.co/M9xYl41BVa

The #COVID19 crisis sheds light on the existing racial disparities in health outcomes for our communities of color. 
I applaud @MayorBronin & public health officials in taking steps to address this issue. https://t.co/igHMhIyVcC

Students are not in classrooms but thousands will take a day-long vow of silence, bringing attention to the abuse aimed at their LGBTQ classmates. This harassment hurts student's education and must stop. #NationalDayofSilence

Testing, testing, testing- is vital to protecting our front-line workers and mitigating the spread of #COVID19. Thank you to all of our community health centers and hospitals on the ground stepping up to increase testing in our communities. https://t.co/1qxS3wA4TK
Connecticut lost a great journalist with the passing of Josh Kovner. My heart goes out to his family and his @hartfordcourant colleagues. https://t.co/Ztw7lqhKAe

Our nation’s health and economic recovery are inextricably linked during this pandemic. Today's #CoronavirusRelief package strengthens the Paycheck Protection Program and brings vital funding to hospitals, healthcare workers, & testing, but more must be done! https://t.co/HY0Z4Qc5g2

This #Ramadan, let us be reminded of the power of faith and community.
 
Ramadan Mubarak to all who observe. https://t.co/1wdRdejYOR

Our food banks are on the frontlines serving families in need amid the #COVID19 crisis. Thank you to @Foodshare and all of our food banks across the state and country who have increased their distribution to meet demand. https://t.co/og65JPQPuR

I joined my colleagues on the Congressional task force to reopen America in sending a letter to the Trump Administration calling for a comprehensive national testing strategy to protect essential, front-line workers & responsibly reopen our economy. https://t.co/y8EVcABrRm

ATTENTION: @NEHGov has announced a new grant program for cultural organizations. Through CARES Act funding this grant program will provide up to $300,000 in emergency relief funding to qualifying cultural organizations. https://t.co/rwraKL0OEe

Today, I joined @RepBobbyRush in calling on @EPA to secure equal rights to clean air protections. Air pollution has not only contributed to the climate crisis, but is linked to the lethality of COVID-19 in our most vulnerable communities.
 
We need action now. #EarthDay https://t.co/bKutj7fW8b

It was great talking with @johndankosky on the @CTMirror podcast “Steady Habits” about my role on the Congressional task force to reopen America and the latest #COVID19 relief package from Congress. Check it out: https://t.co/uxsHpiR8Kc

This initiative between @HartfordHealthC and @QuestDX to significantly increase Connecticut’s #COVID19 testing capacity is critical to containing the spread of #COVID19 and protecting frontline workers. https://t.co/AtaMMx5QBF

On #EarthDay50 we must renew our effort to protect our planet. I introduced the #AmericaWins to lower carbon emissions, fund green energy research, & invest in frontline communities. #ClimateChange is the greatest threat to our planet, we must address it. https://t.co/VBNyzyUm0o https://t.co/clPHiFzCTl

This #NationalVolunteerWeek I thank all of our volunteers who have helped our communities respond to the #COVID19 crisis by organizing food banks, sewing masks, giving blood, and so much more. https://t.co/zrCJypI8iz

On this #HolocaustRemembranceDay we reflect on this dark stain in human history and remind ourselves that we cannot stand by idly in the face of injustice and intolerance. Today, and everyday we must pledge to always speak out against hate and antisemitism. #NeverForget https://t.co/UBWgn4dtGs

The CARES Act provides unemployment insurance to individuals who have become unemployed due to #COVID19. Emergency benefit increases of $600 per week to individuals will begin to be paid out on 4/27 & payments will be retro to the 1st week in which the claimant filed for benefits

I have heard from businesses of all sizes and types, including minority-owned and rural businesses, non profits, and the self-employed that the relief provided by the CARES Act was not enough and loans were not equally distributed or delivered as promised. We need to do better.

We must remember: this is a public health crisis first. We need a science-based comprehensive national plan requiring testing, contact tracing and benchmarks to keep Americans safe before restrictions are lifted in our communities. https://t.co/bcWJb9zrvZ

https://t.co/Pyf5WPFPgh

Thanks to hard work by the @CTDOL, Unemployment Insurance claims will be processed in one week or less. Current applicants waiting for processing should check their email for instructions on how to expedite processing.

This week, I join my colleagues in recognizing #BlackMaternalHealthWeek. We must address the crisis black women face in unacceptably high maternal mortality rates. It is imperative we fix this crisis for the invaluable moms in our communities, especially as we combat #COVID19

As public health experts and most notably, Dr. Fauci have stated, the COVID-19 pandemic is first and foremost a health crisis, which has devastated the economy.  We must work to address both issues head on and at the same time. This is an enormous challenge.
